PERSONAL DETAILS
Location:			Berkshire

Doctor of Philosophy Applied and Computational Mathematics - Imperial College 2016
ENG Dissertation Title: Numeric Modelling of a Single Symmetric Salt Finger Nominated for the Yael Naim Dowker Centenary Prize in Mathematics - annual award to the most promising PhD student, based upon their thesis
BSc Applied Mathematics - University of Porto 2003
Awarded First Class Honours (16/20 G.P.A.)
Affiliations
Member, Royal Statistical Society
Languages
Portuguese: Mother Tongue
English: Proficient C2

Jan 2022 to date Costain Group plc
Position: Sr. Data Analyst
Created machine learning and neural network models to predict project costs and delays
Appl CANDIDATE 			Joanna Andrade
PERSONAL DETAILS
Location:			Berkshire
QUALIFICATIONS
Doctor of Philosophy Applied and Computational Mathematics - Imperial College 2016
ENG Dissertation Title: Numeric Modelling of a Single Symmetric Salt Finger Nominated for the Yael Naim Dowker Centenary Prize in Mathematics - annual award to the most promising PhD student, based upon their thesis
BSc Applied Mathematics - University of Porto 2003
Awarded First Class Honours (16/20 G.P.A.)
Affiliations
Member, Royal Statistical Society
Languages
Portuguese: Mother Tongue
English: Proficient C2
Spanish: Advanced C1
French: Upper Intermediate B2
CAREER SUMMARY
Jan 2022 to date Costain Group plc
Position: Sr. Data Analyst
Created machine learning and neural network models to predict project costs and delays
Applied natural language and topic modelling models in the context of feature engineering
Used anomaly and outlier detection techniques to investigate fraud in the usage of fuel cards and other company resources
Analysed geographical information system (GIS) data
Nov 2016 to Dec 2021 National Foundation for Educational Research
Position: Sr Statistician
Manager of the statistical and psychometrics team in charge of developing the transition from paper based to electronic assessment (eAssessment platform) of reading and and maths tests for Year 3, 4 and 5.
Applied econometric and regression models to educational and international large scale assessment databases, including the National Pupil Database, in order to derive information and insights that informed NFER's Research and Evaluation and International Education centres.
Co-authored an internal strategic plan for the introduction and implementation of Artificial Intelligence methodologies in NFER's Research Group and Assessment Centre.
Applied Natural Language Processing methodologies to the analysis of twitter data (sentiment analysis) and open ended questionnaires and surveys (topic modelling).
Applied Item Response Theory (IRT) models to the development of tests aimed at primary school children.
Automated the generation of analysis feedbacks, reports and tables that were formerly written by researchers.
May 2016 to Nov 2016 London Mathematical Society
Position: Grace Chisolm Young Fellow
Research on computational fluid dynamics using a combination of analytic and direct numerical simulation methods
April 2014 to Nov 2016 4ChangeCrl
Position: Consultant
Applied of quantitative and statistical methodologies to social impact assessment (SROI).
Analysed surveys and questionnaires.
Liaised with a team of economists and social scientists in order to integrate quantitative and statistical methods in the social impact assessment projects.
COMMENT
Talented and self-motivated data scientist with significant experience in data mining and statistical analysis. Offering a solid academic research background and nine years of progressive leadership experience across various technical industries.
Skills
Expertise in the use of statistical and analytical software (R, Excel, SPSS, C++)
Basic knowledge of Python and Power BI
Communication skills
Team management and mentorship
Problem solving
Attention to detail
Self-motivated
For further information please contact Julie Smith on 01695 570 696 or email julie.smith@johnston-vere.co.uk

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
